subtitle: the journey home a Kryon parable the
story of michael thomas and the seven
angels written by lee carol dedication
to those who have realized that a human
has the power to change his or her life
and that things are not always as they
seem
who is cryin crime is a gentle loving
entity who is currently on the earth to
help us move into the high energy of
what we call our new age crayons words
have changed lives and brought love and
light into some of the darkest places of
our inner beam the storyline for the
journey home was inspired by cryin and
written by Lee Carol introduction on
December 8th 1996 Kryon sat before more
than 500 people in Laguna Hills
California at the close of an afternoon
seminar in a storytelling session that
lasted over an hour the journey of
Michael Thomas was presented a trek born
of the desire of an earth weary human to
join his spiritual family and go home
the very name Michael Thomas represents
the incredibly sacred and holy
attributes of the Archangel Michael and
also the old energy properties of Thomas
the doubter this combination represents
many of us who feel we are spiritual
beings but often doubt our ability to
move forward into a new millennium as
increasing spiritual demands or
fear-based challenges Michaels journey
home slowly reveals an adventure through
seven colorful houses each occupied by a
grand angel each house represents an
attribute of the new age and carries
with it wisdom teaching humor and
insight into what it is God wants us to
know about ourselves we also get a
glimpse of the way things work as we
move through the new paradigm of our new
age progressing to a moving and
surprising and Michael Thomas's journey
reveals to humans a package of loving
instructions coming from the spiritual
source that constantly desires to wash
our feet if you've ever asked God what
is it that you want me to know
this may be it
join Michael Thomas and his exciting
journey it may remind you of your own
chapter 1 Michael Thomas the black
plastic pieces flew in all directions as
my pushed as in box a bit too hard
against the cubicle wall of a sales
office
it was another instance where an
inanimate object bore the brunt of

everything okay over there asked John
from the next cubicle the walls of each

that even mentioned it Michael Thomas
was in his mid-30s like many others in

very much he could simply disengage for
eight hours a day go home sleep try to

30 individuals he just didn't care and
he had been at this for over a year
ever since the emotional breakup at at
shatters life forever he never shared
his memories with anyone but they ran

lived alone except for a solitary fish
he had wanted a cat but the landlord
wouldn't allow it
he knew he was playing the victim but
his self-esteem was at an all-time low
and he continued to massage the wound
that was his life purposely keeping it
open hurt and bleeding so he can recall
it all at will there wasn't anything
else he felt he could do and he wasn't
certain he had the energy to change
things even if he wanted to he had named
the fish cat just for fun and he would

keep the faith cat Mike would say to his
finned friend on the way out of course
the fish never said anything in return
over six feet tall Mike was somewhat
imposing until he smiled his grin
carried with it a charm that melted all

almost like a self-imposed prison

mic his male coworker said when is the

she on the other hand had just been

and I always kept photos around to

through everything even now Mike kept

Mike openly admitted his faith in the

he had many opportunities to take

perhaps it was because the weather was

how ironic he thought Mike's only female

therefore he treated all women with the

actually Mike's experience had only been

the California girl who had broken his

love but Mike hadn't seen it that way he

didn't have tolerance for other ideas
